availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Timothy Jackson (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and private 20th Ky Inf)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Jackson and Winifred Jackson. Farmhand in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from January 6, 1862, to August 11, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 347A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 88.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 48.
